poll_list.title: Prioritize Onboarding a Compound DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) - January 10, 2022
Add the Compound V2 DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) - November 7, 2022

discourse_list.title: [Signal Request] Should Maker Prioritize Onboarding A Compound D3M?

content.content: Overview MakerDAO has recently tested and implemented the DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) as outlined in MIP50. This has allowed for Maker to directly inject DAI liquidity onto the Aave market, and has been successful in generating both DAI yield and stkAAVE for the Maker Protocol. The initial debt ceiling of 10m DAI was increased to 40m on November 15, and again to 100m on November 29. To date, Aave has been the only implementation of the D3M. Signal Request GFX Labs, in consultation with the @Growth-Core-Unit and prominent Compound community members, is signaling to prioritize onboarding a D3M for the Compound DAI market. Pros  More revenue Diversified counterparty risk Demonstrates the MakerDAO does not favor Aave  Cons  More risk of targeting interest rates having adverse effects on the peg Additional smart contract risk from adding another counterparty platform  Effect In the event this signal is successful, Maker will prioritize the implementation of a Compound D3M at parameters recommended by the core units involved in that process.    Should Maker Prioritize Onboarding A Compound D3M?  Yes No Abstain     0 voters     This Signal Request will close on 2021-12-17.
content.GPT-summary: The post is a signal request by GFX Labs, in consultation with the Growth-Core-Unit and prominent Compound community members, to prioritize onboarding a D3M for the Compound DAI market. The post provides an overview of MakerDAO's recent implementation of the DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) and its success in generating DAI yield and stkAAVE for the Maker Protocol. The post also lists the pros and cons of onboarding a Compound D3M and asks the community to vote on whether Maker should prioritize its implementation.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Fixed polling options and added a date for the end-of-poll such that this complies with the signal guidelines.
GFXlabs:  targeting interest rates having adverse effects on the peg   for a separate thread altogether but maybe this can be worked into risk modeling of these modules?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I would love to point out that Compound is developing a more or less direct competitor to MCD in form of Compound CASH. This may be the reason for Maker Governance to:  favor AAVE not prioritize this module

content.content: You raise good points however I still think there is value in developing the compound D3M as it will give Maker Governance more options and it adds more support for DAI. Governance can still choose to favor AAVE by offering a lower bar on the AAVE D3M module.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: We are going to be stuck in old way if we view Compound as a competitor and miss our chance to grow further. Literally even direct competitors (between different Stablecoins or mainnets) are collaborating to find synergy in the market these days. I support expanding to Compound ecosystem
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: 110% agree with this sentiment. MakerDAO needs to actively support the greater DeFi ecosystem so we can keep up and be a champion in the growth of the space!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: krzkaczor:  I would love to point out that Compound is developing a more or less direct competitor to MCD in form of Compound CASH.   I think we can see what this looks like if/when it comes out, and control for not assisting direct competitors through debt ceilings/rates. If more users on Compound use DAI as the primary borrow currency it may actually give us more leverage in the situation they launch CASH or even to prevent it being launched altogether.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This Signal Request has now ended. As the community has voted in favour, it will move to an on-chain vote when the Governance Cycle restarts on Monday, January 10th.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Quite excited to see the community supporting such expansions.

Fyi, Risk Core Unit is in final stages of Compound D3M Risk Assessment. I personally think implementation with Compound is useful for two main reasons: diversification of D3M counterparty risks and the fact that Compound DAI borrow rates have been normally about 1% higher than those at Aave (incl. incentives), which makes competitive risks smaller.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
